summary: This document is an email correspondence involving Jeffrey Epstein, Mary E. Erdoes, and Jes Staley discussing a charitable donation initiative. Epstein outlines a proposal for establishing a portfolio for donors with various focus areas, indicating a minimum donation requirement of $100 million. The email also contains a confidentiality notice.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein initiates the email discussing a charitable donation proposal and outlines the structure for donor portfolios.

persons.name: Mary E. Erdoes
persons.context: Erdoes is included in the email correspondence regarding the charitable donation initiative.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Staley is also a recipient of the email discussing the donation proposal.

persons.name: Boris Nikolic
persons.context: Nikolic is copied on the email regarding the charitable donation initiative.

connections.description: Epstein communicates with Erdoes regarding a charitable initiative.
Epstein discusses a charitable donation proposal with Staley.
Nikolic is included in the email chain about the charitable donation initiative.

keyFacts: The minimum donation discussed is $100 million.
A portfolio will be established for each donor according to their criteria.
The email mentions various focus areas for donations including Medicine, Science, Women's issues, and Education.
All fees related to the charitable initiative will be managed by JPMorgan.
The email contains a confidentiality notice indicating it may be attorney-client privileged.
